name: cist
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a stone structure or container used in ancient times to bury bodies or bones : More than twenty prehistoric burial chambers, called cists, have so far been found on the island. The burial site was a cist grave lined with stone slabs, found beneath one of the earliest buildings.
More examplesFewer examplesThey discovered a cist of three chambers containing human bones and a few pottery fragments.Many burial and religious sites remain in the form of barrows, cists, and stone circles.
